Name: Designating July 8 annually as Reggie “Combat Jack” Ossé Day in the City of New York and honoring his multifaceted contributions to the Hip Hop industry as a lawyer, executive, editor, and podcaster.
Title: Resolution designating July 8 annually as Reggie “Combat Jack” Ossé Day in the City of New York and honoring his multifaceted contributions to the Hip Hop industry as a lawyer, executive, editor, and podcaster.
BodyName: Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations

History.Description: This Resolution was Introduced by Council
This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
History.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations

History.Description: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations

History.Description: This Resolution was Laid Over by Committee

History.Description: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations

History.Description: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
History.BodyName: Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations

History.Description: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
History.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
History.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following Council Member formally noted his intention to abstain from voting on this item: 
Council Member Ossé.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.

Attachments.Name: Minutes of the Stated Meeting - May 11, 2023
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - June 22, 2023

Text:
Whereas, Hip Hop lawyer, executive, editor, and podcaster Reginald (Reggie) Joseph Oss� was born on July 8, 1964, in Brooklyn and raised in the Crown Heights neighborhood; and
      Whereas, After graduating from Cornell University and Georgetown University Law Center, Oss� went to work as a lawyer at Def Jam in the early days of the Hip Hop revolution, before founding his own firm with lawyer Ed Woods; and
      Whereas, Oss�'s early clients included the founders of Roc-A-Fella Records, Damon Dash and JAY-Z, and other notable Hip Hop artists; and
      Whereas, After leaving the law profession, Oss� worked as an executive at MTV and became managing editor of The Source, one of the world's longest-running magazines about Hip Hop culture and politics; and
      Whereas, Oss�'s career took a turn into writing about and, eventually in 2010, broadcasting about Hip Hop, under the name Combat Jack; and
      Whereas, On The Combat Jack Show, Oss� was known for his ability to conduct in-depth and insightful interviews with Hip Hop legends, including his longtime friends and associates, who were not nearly so talkative with other broadcasters, as well as with filmmakers, social activists, and more; and
      Whereas, The Combat Jack Show was described in XXL, a well-known Hip Hop magazine, as "effectively the beginning of big-time rap podcasts as we know them today"; and 
      Whereas, The success of Oss�'s show, with a fan base of hundreds of thousands, led to his co-founding with Chris Morrow in 2013 of Loud Speakers Network, which went on to help build the careers of younger Hip Hop broadcasters; and
      Whereas, According to journalist and critic Juan Vidal, who interviewed Oss� for a book about Hip Hop and fatherhood, Oss� said that family came first for him, noting that "[n]o guest, no event, no conference call, nothing...[b]eing a father comes first"; and
      Whereas, Vidal wrote in Esquire of his final interview in 2016 with Oss�, in which Oss� concluded, "I love being a rap dad...a rap kid who grew up with the backdrop of hip-hop and rap, became a man, and now shares that experience with his children"; and
      Whereas, Vidal praised Oss� for his "humility, and the energy he put into imparting knowledge to others"; and 
      Whereas, Oss� died on December 20, 2017, after a short and very public struggle with colon cancer; and
      Whereas, It is appropriate to dedicate a day to commemorate the legacy of those individuals who helped make the Hip Hop industry the cultural, political, and economic success that it is today in New York City and around the world; now, therefore, be it
	Resolved, That the Council of the City of New York designates July 8 annually as Reggie "Combat Jack" Oss� Day in the City of New York and honors his multifaceted contributions to the Hip Hop industry as a lawyer, executive, editor, and podcaster.

\pard\ltrpar\sl480\slmult1\qj By Council Members Oss\'e9, Cab\'e1n, Riley, Louis, Rivera, Sanchez, Nurse, Hudson and Far\'edas\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Whereas, Hip Hop lawyer, executive, editor, and podcaster Reginald (Reggie) Joseph Oss\'e9 was born on July 8, 1964, in Brooklyn and raised in the Crown Heights neighborhood; and\par
Whereas, After graduating from Cornell University and Georgetown University Law Center, Oss\'e9 went to work as a lawyer at Def Jam in the early days of the Hip Hop revolution, before founding his own firm with lawyer Ed Woods; and\par
Whereas, Oss\'e9\rquote s early clients included the founders of Roc-A-Fella Records, Damon Dash and JAY-Z, and other notable Hip Hop artists; and\par
Whereas, After leaving the law profession, Oss\'e9 worked as an executive at MTV and became managing editor of \i The Source\i0 , one of the world\rquote s longest-running magazines about Hip Hop culture and politics; and\par
Whereas, Oss\'e9\rquote s career took a turn into writing about and, eventually in 2010, broadcasting about Hip Hop, under the name Combat Jack; and\par
Whereas, On \i The Combat Jack Show\i0 , Oss\'e9 was known for his ability to conduct in-depth and insightful interviews with Hip Hop legends, including his longtime friends and associates, who were not nearly so talkative with other broadcasters, as well as with filmmakers, social activists, and more; and\par
Whereas, \i The Combat Jack Show\i0  was described in \i XXL\i0 , a well-known Hip Hop magazine, as \ldblquote effectively the beginning of big-time rap podcasts as we know them today\rdblquote ; and \par
Whereas, The success of Oss\'e9\rquote s show, with a fan base of hundreds of thousands, led to his co-founding with Chris Morrow in 2013 of Loud Speakers Network, which went on to help build the careers of younger Hip Hop broadcasters; and\par
Whereas, According to journalist and critic Juan Vidal, who interviewed Oss\'e9 for a book about Hip Hop and fatherhood, Oss\'e9 said that family came first for him, noting that \ldblquote [n]o guest, no event, no conference call, nothing\'85[b]eing a father comes first\rdblquote ; and\par
Whereas, Vidal wrote in \i Esquire\i0  of his final interview in 2016 with Oss\'e9, in which Oss\'e9 concluded, \ldblquote I love being a rap dad\'85a rap kid who grew up with the backdrop of hip-hop and rap, became a man, and now shares that experience with his children\rdblquote ; and\par
Whereas, Vidal praised Oss\'e9 for his \ldblquote humility, and the energy he put into imparting knowledge to others\rdblquote ; and \par
Whereas, Oss\'e9 died on December 20, 2017, after a short and very public struggle with colon cancer; and\par
Whereas, It is appropriate to dedicate a day to commemorate the legacy of those individuals who helped make the Hip Hop industry the cultural, political, and economic success that it is today in New York City and around the world; now, therefore, be it\par
\pard\ltrpar\sl480\slmult1\qj\tab Resolved, That the Council of the City of New York designates July 8 annually as Reggie \ldblquote Combat Jack\rdblquote  Oss\'e9 Day in the City of New York and honors his multifaceted contributions to the Hip Hop industry as a lawyer, executive, editor, and podcaster.\par
